results.title: Baden Powell: chief scout of the world
results.brief_description: The life story of the founder of the Boy Scout Movement, compiled form original film records. His early life is shown by linking photographs and his personal sketches of such important events as the Ashanti campaign and the siege of Mafeking. From its unofficial beginning in South Africa the Movement is traced to the Boy Scout groups which Baden-Powell established all over Britain. He is seen attending world jamboree as World Chief Scout, and excerpts from his addresses are given. No other credits available.

results.title: Bad taste (D)
results.brief_description: Peter Jackson’s low budget feature debut originally began life as a 10 minute splatter film called “Roast of the day” but was then expanded into a feature, painstakingly shot over a period of four years worth of Sunday’s. The comedy/horror film which gave rise to the term splatstick proudly lives up to it’s bad taste title, offering many gross moments of extreme gore, inventively executed on it’s shoestring budget. The bare bones plot revolves a round a team of alien hunters (the Astro Investigation and Defence Service with the unfortunate acronym of AIDS), who have been sent into the sleepy New Zealand town of Kaihoro where a gang of nasty extra-terrestrials lead by the ghastly Lord Crumb, have taken over. Of course much blood and viscera is spilt as the team discover the aliens evil plan to turn the inhabitants of the town into food. Cast includes Terry Potter, Peter Jackson, Peter O’Herne, Craig Smith, Mike Minett and Doug Wren.

results.title: Bad girls. Series two. Discs 3 & 4 [DVD]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bad girls. Series two”.
The Leaving: (wri. Jayne Hollinson, dir. Mike Adams): Shell’s back on enhanced and is targetting Barbara. Dominic and Zandra are drawn closer through her illness. Denny and Crystal get a new roommate in the young Shaz. “Family plan” (wri. Phil Ford, dir. Mike Adams): Shaz explains to Denny the circumstances of her triple murder charge. Barbara confesses to the attack on Shell. Julie’s trying to have another baby and someone from Yvonne’s past is the latest addtion to the ward. Babes behind bars go under. “Rough justice” (wri. Ann McManus, dir. Mike Adams): Renee’s got it in for everyone and dies under mysterious circumstances. Sylvia is reprimanded over an incident involving Denny and Shaz. Fenner’s having family troubles. “Facing up” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Laurence Moody): Jim’s mind isn’t on the job, to the detriment of his fellow officers. Nikki’s jealous of Helen and Dominic, Helen has a plan to make Shaz realise the consequence of her actions. “Oh what a night” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, Ann McManus, dir. Laurence Moody): Nikki will do anything to spend one night with Helen on the eve of a party to celebrate Sylvia’s 30 years in the service. Crystal leaves Lark Hall.

group.title: Bad girls. Series two
group.creator_credit: Brian Park and Shed Productions (Jailbirds) Ltd

results.title: Bad girls. Series two. Discs 1 & 2 [DVD]
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Bad girls. Series two”.
Tug of love (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Mike Adams): Helen is suspected of going AWOL and Jim’s eyeing off her job. Zandra goes into labour and complications ensue from her drug habit. Karen Betts (Claire King) returns to the wing. “Shit happens” (wri. Martin Allen, dir. Mike Adams): Jim’s wife is getting prank calls from Shell and Jim blames Nikki. Helen hands in her resignation and Fenner is temporarily stood down pending an investigation into an assault on Shell. “Visiting time” (wri. Mark Wadlow, dir. Laurence Moody): Karen Betts becomes Wing Governor. Yvonne helps Julie see her kids. Investigations are underway into the assault case against Shell. “Looking for love” (wri. Jayne Hollinson, dir. Laurence Moody): Dominic becomes Shell’s personal officer. Denny leaves the wing to visit her mother in hospital. The Julies help organise a romantic dinner. “Mistaken identity” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Laurence Moody): Group therapy sessions begin and HIV+ Mad Tessa Spall arrives on the wing. Fenner and Atkins form a mutually beneficial alliance. Wade gets a new roommate. “Losing it” (wri. Martin Allen, dir. Jim O’Hanlon): Sylvia’s given a new exercise regime and Zandra finally gets glasses. Barbara is feeling uncomfortable living with Nikki. Josh and Crystal’s relationship is progressing and Shell starts an anti-male campaign. Helen’s back on the ward working with area management, meaning she can spend more time with Nikki. “The Set up” (wri. Phil Ford, dir. Jim O’Hanlon): Shell’s under observation in the medical ward. Zandra collapses and further investigation is required to find out what’s wrong. Fenner’s being blackmailed by Atkins but he has the last word. “Babes behind bars” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Jim O’Hanlon): Shell’s worrying about the safety of her children. It’s Crystal’s last week and Yvonne comes up with a way to earn a few extra quid. Barbara helps out by setting up the website, “Babes behind bars”. The results are back from Zandra’s test.

group.title: Bad girls. Series two
group.creator_credit: Brian Park and Shed Productions (Jailbirds) Ltd

results.title: Bad girls. Series two
results.creator_credit: Brian Park and Shed Productions (Jailbirds) Ltd
results.brief_description: Inspired by the success of Australia’s “Prisoner” comes the British production of “Bad girls”, also set in a women only prison. Governor of G Ward is Helen Stewart (Simone Lahbib), a boss with a conscience unafraid of standing up for the rights of the prisoners. The core group of women comprise of: Shell (Debra Stephenson), a lifer and the toughest woman on the ward, Denny (Alicia Eyo), Shell’s faithful sidekick and occasional lover, Nikki (Mandana Jones) a thinking lesbian who isn’t afraid to speak her mind and has unresolved sexual tension with the Governor, and the Julies, 2 women called Julie fond of finishing one another’s sentences. An engrossing mix of violence inflicted by women towards women and the inadequacies of the prison system, it also attempts to capture the vagary of relationships and emotions experienced by women who share confined quarters and are without civil liberties. Devised by Maureen Chadwick, Eileen Gallagher and Ann McManus, this award winning series is now in its 5th season. Season two saw the arrival of Karen Betts (Claire King) and Barbara Hunt (Isabelle Amyes), and more high profile stories for Yvonne Atkins, Crystal and Zandra. For more information, visit the official website http://www.badgirls.co.uk

results.title: Bad girls. Series one. Discs 3 & 4
results.creator_credit: Brian Park and Shed Productions (Jailbirds) Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bad girls. Series one”.
Playing with fire (wri. Ann McManus, dir. Jim O’Hanlon): Zandra’s under pressure from Shell to find her stash of smuggled drugs and is quick to drop in Warden Rose. Nikki moves in next door to Shell and Lorna’s career is in jeopardy. Shell has her privileges stripped. “Falling apart” (wri. Sally Wainwright, dir. Mike Adams): Shell uses her powers of sexual persuasion to get back into the threes. The Louises get into wine making and Monica receives devastating news. “Pay back time” (wri. Martin Allen, dir. Mike Adams): Lorna returns from holidays, Monica’s still not speaking and Shell claims she’s come off drugs and found religion. She also vows to settle a score with Lorna. Helen struggles to resist Nikki’s charms. “Love hurts” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Mike Adams): Monica’s appeal nears. New prisoner Yvonne Atkins (Linda Henry) is making a good impression on the women and is full of lots of inventive ideas for improvement. There’s tension between Helen and Nikki and Helen’s having second thoughts about her impending marriage.

results.title: Bad girls. Series one. Discs 1 & 2 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Brian Park and Shed Productions (Jailbirds) Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bad girls. Series one”.
Them and us (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Mike Adams): Rehearsals are underway for a fashion show, meanwhile, Carol (Ashley Miller) is in danger of miscarrying and its her word against the wardens that her life was deliberately put in danger. First timer Rachel arrives on the ward and is targeted by Shell and comforted by Warden Fenner (Jack Ellis). “Drug wars” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Mike Adams): Two new prisoners arrive on the ward. Distinguished Monica (Jane Lowe), charged with fraud and worrying about her disabled son, and the drug addicted Zandra (Lara Cazalet). Drug testing procedures are under scrutiny after an anonymous letter questions their credibility. “Love rivals” (wri. Phil Ford, dir. Laurence Moody): Zandra wants special permission to marry in jail. Shell is aggravated to discover she’s being traded in for younger model. Denny gets a new roommate in the religious Crystal. “The Victim” (wri. Martin Allen, dir. Laurence Moody): Zandra organises an abortion of her ex-fiancee’s child and uses it as an opportunity to escape. Rachel fears for her safety as Shell’s bullying escalates and she’s moved from her single cell back in with the others. Nikki breaks up with Trish and discloses to Monica why she’s in there. “Tangled web” (wri. Louise Page, dir. Laurence Moody): An investigation is commenced into Rachel’s death and Fenner has his own agenda to attend to. Shell makes the surprise announcement that she wants to sing at the funeral. Nikki assaults Shell and Zandra’s blackmailing Lorna. “A Big mistake” (wri. Tom Higgins, dir. Jim O’Hanlon): Dominic is talked out of resigning by Stewart and also has to contest with distressed new prisoner Jessie, a recovering alcoholic and manic depressive.

Mike Adams): Rehearsals are underway for a fashion show, meanwhile, Carol (Ashley Miller) is in danger of miscarrying and its her word against the wardens that her life was deliberately put in danger. First timer Rachel arrives on the ward and is targeted by Shell and comforted by Warden Fenner (Jack Ellis). “Drug wars” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Mike Adams): Two new prisoners arrive on the ward. Distinguished Monica (Jane Lowe), charged with fraud and worrying about her disabled son, and the drug addicted Zandra (Lara Cazalet). Drug testing procedures are under scrutiny after an anonymous letter questions their credibility. “Love rivals” (wri. Phil Ford, dir. Laurence Moody): Zandra wants special permission to marry in jail. Shell is aggravated to discover she’s being traded in for younger model. Denny gets a new roommate in the religious Crystal. “The Victim” (wri. Martin Allen, dir. Laurence Moody): Zandra organises an abortion of her ex-fiancee’s child and uses it as an opportunity to escape. Rachel fears for her safety as Shell’s bullying escalates and she’s moved from her single cell back in with the others. Nikki breaks up with Trish and discloses to Monica why she’s in there. “Tangled web” (wri. Louise Page, dir. Laurence Moody): An investigation is commenced into Rachel’s death and Fenner has his own agenda to attend to. Shell makes the surprise announcement that she wants to sing at the funeral. Nikki assaults Shell and Zandra’s blackmailing Lorna. “A Big mistake” (wri. Tom Higgins, dir. Jim O’Hanlon): Dominic is talked out of resigning by Stewart and also has to contest with distressed new prisoner Jessie, a recovering alcoholic and manic depressive.

group.title: Bad girls. Series one
group.creator_credit: Brian Park and Shed Productions (Jailbirds) Ltd

group_siblings.title: Bad girls. Series one. Discs 3 & 4

results.title: Bad girls. Series one
results.creator_credit: Brian Park and Shed Productions (Jailbirds) Ltd
results.brief_description: Inspired by the success of Australia’s “Prisoner” comes the British production of “Bad girls”, also set in a woman’s only prison. Governor of G Ward is Helen Stewart (Simone Lahbib), a boss with a conscience unafraid of standing up for the rights of the prisoners. The core group of women comprise of: Rachel (Joanne Froggatt), first timer, victimised and vulnerable, Shell (Debra Stephenson), a lifer and the toughest woman on the ward, Denny (Alicia Eyo), Shell’s faithful sidekick and occasional lover, Nikki (Mandana Jones) a thinking lesbian who isn’t afraid to speak her mind and has unresolved sexual tension with the Governor, and the Julies, 2 women called Julie fond of finishing one another’s sentences. An engrossing mix of violence inflicted by women towards women and the inadequacies of the prison system, it also attempts to capture the vagary of relationships and emotions experienced by women who share confined quarters and are without civil liberties. Devised by Maureen Chadwick, Eileen Gallagher and Ann McManus, this award winning series is now in its 5th season. For more information, visit the official website http://www.badgirls.co.uk

results.title: Bad day
results.brief_description:
Prue’s home and she’s not happy. But she knows what to do and if she could do it again, she’d do it all over you.
Features Susan Wallace as Prue.

results.title: Bad by design: designers break the rules
results.creator_credit: Jo Forsyth, Blurred, Australian Film Commission, Film Queensland, Damien Ledwich and Terry Murphy
results.brief_description: From the Australian Film Commission’s Micro Docs Series II, Bad by Design explores the designing and creative process of three Australian designers; Max Bannah (Animator), Elisabeth Watson-Brown (Architect) and Mimmo Cozzolino (Graphic Designer). They reveal their goals with their work and how they’ve made their unique vision and approach succeed. All are highly accomplished in their own right and give the viewer a glimpse of their motivations and creative outlook. Illustrative animations by Damien Ledwich based on the Designers are intermixed throughtout.
